title: Official Sega Genesis Console And Cartridge Dioramas Restocked At Amazon
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               After selling out earlier this year, the officially licensed Sega Genesis cartridge dioramas are being restocked just in time for the holidays. Wilder Toys' Console Heroes collection includes replica Genesis cartridges that flip open to reveal dioramas featuring characters and scenes from classic games. The fresh batch releases November 30, and all four cartridge dioramas are available to preorder for $18 each: Sonic the Hedgehog 2, Sonic the Hedgehog 3, Super Street Fighter 2, Altered Beast.While you wait for your preorders to arrive, you can start your Console Heroes collection by picking up a $40 bundle featuring a Sega Genesis console diorama and a cartridge tray for the upcoming game dioramas. And if you like Stranger Things, there's a VHS tape diorama from Console Heroes releasing November 30.                                 Sega Genesis Console Diorama & Cartridge Tray                                                                $40 | Available Now                                                                                                                                                                                    The Sega Genesis Supervillain Boss Bundle Display includes a foldable diorama of the Sega Genesis console featuring four villain figures:Mecha Sonic Mk IIDeath Egg RobotMr. XDeath BringerAll of the figures from the cartridge dioramas listed below can be displayed on platforms inside the Genesis diorama.As an added bonus, you get a Sega Genesis-branded tray to store the Console Heroes cartridge dioramas. The tray has six slots, so the Console Heroes lineup seems very likely to grow in the future.                                                      Adorable New Astro Bot Collectibles Are Waiting To Be Rescued By You                         Amazon Has Tons Of Horror Movie Box Sets For Low Prices In Halloween Sale                         Lego's New Spider-Man And Iron Man Busts Get Limited-Timed Discounts                                   + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)                 Joe Hill's Massive New Horror-Fantasy Novel Arrives Just In Time For Halloween                         Icon Blue Limited Edition DualSense PS5 Controller Is Available Now                         Lego Technic McLaren F1 Race Car Retires Soon, Save $72 At Amazon Before It's Gone                         Pokemon TCG Amazon-Exclusive Holiday Premium Collection Is Back In Stock                         Get 10 Shudder Original Horror Movies On Blu-Ray For Only $51

title: Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Gets Its Own Pokemon Battle Academy-Style Intro Game
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               Asmodee has taken a page out of the Pokemon playbook with its latest addition to the Star Wars: Unlimited TCG catalog. Intro Battle Hoth is a standalone experience geared toward new players of the official Star Wars trading card game. It's very similar in concept to Pokemon TCG: Battle Academy and Disney Lorcana: Gateway. The fast-paced spin on Star Wars: Unlimited is available now for $20. As an added bonus, the game is themed around the Battle of Hoth from The Empire Strikes Back.                                 Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - Intro Battle Hoth                                                                $20                                                                                                                                                                                    Intro Battle Hoth is a head-to-head game for two players that takes roughly 20 minutes to play. Asmodee recommends Star Wars: Unlimited for players ages 12 and up.The $20 "New Player Game" comes with two pre-built, 50-card decks. Princess Leia and the Rebel forces must defend Echo Base from Darth Vader and his Imperial Army. Much like Pokemon Battle Academy, Intro Battle Hoth comes with an illustrated game board with labeled spots for cards.There's also a full rulebook and all accessories needed to play. Here's the full list of contents inside the box:104 Cards  Princess Leia's Rebel Forces DeckDarth Vader's Imperial Army DeckGame Board57 Damage Counters2 Epic Action Counters1 Initiative Counter1 Rulebook1 Info Sheet                      Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - Intro Battle HothStar Wars: Unlimited TCG Boxes, Boosters, DecksStar Wars: Unlimited TCG debuted in March 2024 with a 252-card set called Spark of Rebellion. Asmodee has since released four more sets, and the next one, Secrets of Power, is slated for November 7. The prolific card/board game manufacturer has already confirmed three Star Wars: Unlimited TCG sets for 2026: A Lawless Time, Ashes of the Empire, and. Homeworlds.If you're interested in collecting Star Wars: Unlimited cards, we've rounded up the Booster Boxes, Prerelease Boxes, Spotlight Decks, and Starter Sets you can buy now below.Browse by category:Starter SetsSpotlight DecksPrerelease Boxes2025 Gift BoxBooster BoxesBooster PacksCarbonite Booster Boxes                                                                                                                                               Star Wars: Unlimited Starter SetsStar Wars: Unlimited TCG Starter SetsThe first three Star Wars: Unlimited sets had $35 Starter Sets with two pre-built decks.Each Starter Set comes with two 50-card decks--10 of the cards are exclusive--and deck boxes with character art of the named leaders. The Starter Sets also come with a quickstart rules guide and various damage counters.Shadows of the Galaxy: Moff Gideon / The Mandalorian -- $31.81 ($35)Twilight of the Republic: Ahsoka / General Grevious -- $35Spark of Rebellion: Luke Skywalker / Darth Vader -- Sold outStar Wars: Unlimited Spotlight DecksStar Wars: Unlimited TCG Spotlight DecksAsmodee ditched the Starter Sets for a pair of individual decks called Spotlight Decks in 2025.Each Spotlight Deck comes with a 50-card deck--four of the cards are exclusive--and a booster pack with 16 cards. It's worth noting that the 50-card decks include some cards from previous sets. Each deck has a named leaderLegends of the ForceDarth Maul -- $25Qui-Gon Jinn -- $25Jump to LightspeedHan Solo -- $24Boba Fett -- $28Star Wars: Unlimited Spotlight Deck DisplaysSpotlight Decks are also available in 6-packs. These are mainly designed for tournament play and for larger groups of friends, since you get three of each Spotlight Deck in the carton.Secrets of Power -- $150 | November 73 Padme Amidala Decks3 Chancellor Palpatine DecksLegends of the Force -- $140 ($150)  3 Darth Maul Decks3 Qui-Gon Jinn DecksJump to Lightspeed -- $117.49 ($150)  3 Han Solo Decks3 Boba Fett DecksStar Wars: Unlimited Booster BoxesStar Wars: Unlimited TCG Booster BoxesBooster Boxes come with 24 packs featuring 16 cards each for a total of 384 cards. Booster Packs retail for $6 each, so Booster Boxes net you four packs free at MSRP. That said, most of the Booster Boxes sell for around $90, which breaks down to less than $4/pack. The 2025 Booster Boxes are the cheapest right now, with Jump to Lightspeed sitting at $73 and Legends of the Force at $88. If you want the original Spark of Rebellion set, the Booster Box for $91 is the way to go.Each Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Pack comes with: 9 common cards, 3 uncommon cards, 1 rare or legendary card, 1 leader, 1 base/token, and 1 foil card.Legends of the Force (24 Packs) -- $88 ($120)Jump to Lightspeed (24 Packs) -- $73 ($120)Twilight of the Republic (24 Packs) -- $92 ($120)Shadows of the Galaxy (24 Packs) -- $91.67 ($120)Spark of Rebellion (24 Packs) -- $91 ($120)Star Wars: Unlimited Booster PacksJump to Lightspeed -- $6Shadows of the Galaxy -- $6.90Spark of Rebellion -- $12.40Star Wars: Unlimited Prerelease BoxesDespite the moniker "Prerelease Box," these aren't exclusive, limited-time bundles. The Prerelease Box is essentially the Elite Trainer Box or MTG Bundle, albeit on a smaller (and cheaper) scale. Each Prerelease Box comes with six Booster Packs with 16 cards in each pack. You'll also get two exclusive promo codes for the Rebel and Empire leaders in the set. Along with the cards, Prerelease Boxes come with damage counters and a quickstart guide.Legends of the Force -- $25 ($30)Jump to Lightspeed -- $28 ($30)Twilight of the Republic -- $30Shadows of the Galaxy -- $38.50Spark of Rebellion -- Sold outStar Wars: Unlimited 2025 Gift BoxOn November 5, Asmodee is releasing a 2025 Gift Box for Star Wars: Unlimited. It's not available to preorder at Amazon, but you can secure one from Walmart. The Gift Box is $30 and includes eight Booster Packs, two exclusive variant cards, and an oversized leader card. You'll get two Boosters from each of the following sets: Secrets of Power, Legends of the Force, Jump to Lightspeed, Twilight of the Republic. title: RV There Yet Is Steam's Latest Out-Of-Nowhere Smash Hit
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          It's been a very good year for...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                It's been a very good year for indie titles on Steam, even in the aftermath of Hollow Knight: Silksong's blockbuster success. Last week, Escape From Duckov somehow briefly outgunned Battlefield 6. Now, another indie game, RV There Yet, has raced past 1.3 million sales in a single week.          RV There Yet is the debut game of Nuggets Entertainment, and up to four players can join this co-op experience as they get behind the wheel of an RV home while attempting a very perilous side route through Mabutts Valley. The goal of the game is to get the RV past obstacles that it would ordinarily be unable to traverse. To pull that off, players will have to leave the RV and creatively use a winch and other tools to get by. As seen in the trailer above, some of those attempts can end very badly. This band of bros also has to deal with wildlife and snakes, which is why an EpiPen is one of their primary tools.According to SteamDB, RV There Yet had over 100,000 concurrent players in its first week. Nuggets Entertainment community manager Jace Varlet subsequently posted the following video, in which he thanks players on behalf of the team. He also explains why the game wasn't marked as "early access."          In short, Nuggets Entertainment didn't expect this game to take off the way it did, and the studio just wanted to finish the title by its internally agreed-upon release date. There weren't originally any plans to add more content to RV There Yet, but that may soon change. Meanwhile, Varlet acknowledged that there are some bugs in the game and he pledged that they will be fixed.There aren't any current plans for RV There Yet to make the leap to consoles, but it's currently on sale on Steam for $7.19 before reverting to its regular price of $8 on October 28. Nuggets has also been concurrently developing another title called Among the Wild, but it just isn't ready for release yet.
